name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ezcmac, Thorfinn, DiamondMonster, GeyserShitdick, SoManyWhales, lk, alejandroadam, Saint)

name: heatbag
text: Its my desktop at work.

name: buttermoths
text:
It's my desktop too.
And it should REALLY be a t-shirt.

name: nabeel84
text: A wallpaper that came out of this? Do you mean you set this image as your wallpaper or is there one based on it? If it is the latter, how do I get it?

name: buttermoths
text: You'll find it at the 'www.achewood.com' frontpage, at the bottom right-hand corner. It's called Trouble Man & No-No, and it's faaabulous. It's STILL my desktop.

name: farqussus
text: despite snorting derision and confusion, likewise.

name: firesign
text: Haven't seen your avatar before, but my mental re-creation of that avatar voicing the word "faaabulous" absolutely chills the blood, man...

name: mikeronomicon
text: I chubby you and retract my previous threat to your reproductive health.

name: asherdan
text: I retract my SCREW YOU, MAN.

name: soticoto
text: I would retract something if I had something to retract, but I'm still amused by the interaction between you two. ^_^

name: afrothunder
text: 8 horrible people were so focused on laming asherdan that they were willing to deny the greatness of this wallpaper. Fuck. You.

name: catachresis
text:
This is kind of a plot-dev strip.
All the plot-dev strips before were sort of OK OK THERE'S A PUNCHLINE 3/5 FOR NOW
This one is precious, like a glass egg. 5

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
precious like a glass egg indeed. i appreciate the strips that require interpretation of events that seem to make little sense or have no point of origin (such as the entire cartilage head series). they force you to look at them closely and wonder which elements have significance, and which don't.

for example, why are these two characters named "Trouble Man" and "No-No"? is there significance to the names...?

name: barrylegg
text:
I'm guessing these characters are named after the record label - Troubleman, and a band on that label - Bride Of No No.

Pretty obscure label, very obscure band.

name: stuart
text: Holy shit. This and the middle piggy having eaten roast beef.

name: tekende
text: Did you make that up?

name: tekende
text:
To answer my own question, I did find a band called Bride of No No.

Have not yet found a label called Troubleman.

name: epicurus
text: Last four panels, yes.

name: tombsgrave
text: The saddest and eeriest Achewood strip.

name: firesign
text: Up until Phillipe began treating Chapstick as a food source, that is...

name: dj_douche
text: Imagine what Beef's feeling, thinking Molly has died in the fire..

name: nathanielperson
text: While I'm happy my vote pushed this one up to 4.4, I'm sad and puzzled that it's so low.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Trouble-man and No-no are the ghosts of 1930s animated short features.

name: darthemed
text: For some reason, they seem like the Deadland versions of Emeril and Spongebath to me. Hanging around, making occasional appearances. But now they've been abandoned. It is a sad thing.

name: stuart
text: EVERYTHING in Achewood is the ghost of a 1930s animated short feature.

name: rachel
text: yeah that is exactly exactly what I was thinking, that these dudes are some kind of creepy onstad interpretation of a really fucked up 1930s cartoon.  aagh, so good

name: randyjohnson
text:
no-no is the tall guy right?
I wish he would return some day

name: imitationcrab
text: The cat in the briefs is No-No

name: julia
text: "All souls did burn."  I think Onstad reads Augustine.

name: mambonassau
text: it's like a cormac mccarthy novel in miniature.

name: spinynorman
text: Seriously, them and Nice Pete give a real McCarthy-apocalyptic feel to Achewood.

name: dak
text:
Alt text : "sister i need wine"

I wonder if Onstad is a Guided by Voices fan.

name: buttermoths
text: It would appear the he, or at least Teodor, thinks that 5% of their songs are not complete jag-off. Don't know if that makes him a fan or not.

name: luckypyjamas
text:
i'm pretty sure that's what it takes

i do like about 5% of their songs, but i like those songs enough to consider myself a fan, i suppose

name: phthoggos
text: Still though, that's about 30 songs

name: luckypyjamas
text:
naw man, they've got about 30 songs average on all their albums

between 20 and 30 typically

so i was overestimating how much i like

maybe 5-10%

i like the songs everyone likes okay

name: iandorrinson
text: ohhhhh shiiiiiit

name: i_love_kate
text:
Heaven was a very small building. Certainly doesn't fit the Revelations template. And now he's standing outside of it.

This perplexes me.

name: drskradley
text:
There's also a distinct lack of topaz. I recall there being other jewels and stuff mentioned in Revelations for the metaphorical bejewelling of Heaven, but for some reason I only remember topaz at the moment. It's been a while since I hit the New Testament prophecy. Read it all in one sitting, I dare ya.

It's a lovely word, though - "topaz." Makes me feel happy.

name: slab64
text: It's my stupid, ugly birthstone. If that's what Heaven is going to be full of, I'm glad that the Rapture is probably going to sneak up on me before I can repent.

name: thesyndicate88
text: Chubbied for November birthday.

name: vandenbos
text:
Heaven is bigger on the inside than it is on the outside.

Yeah, sure, just like the TARDIS.

name: unsentletter
text:
> Heaven is bigger on the inside than it is on the outside.
Yeah, sure, just like the TARDIS.

Yeah, like the TARDIS or Tank Girl's tank from the original Hewlett & Martin comics...

name: death
text: This was my first achewood strip. Ever since I wanted to find out what strange turn of events resulted in this.

name: vymora
text: I have yet to see a strip of this era that matches the complexity of Achewood.  Heaven just burnt down.

name: professorhazard
text: Blister was also in Molly's building. Does that mean he was sent to Earth, alive?

name: fidelio-roo
text: The tall black one reminds me of Jason comics.

name: hellofditties
text: 5 for making my spine shiver.  This is a beautiful strip, it has such a nightmarish quality to it.

name: dasuta
text:
I am immediately drawn to a quote delivered in 3:10 to Yuma.

"You Will Burn. This Town Will Burn!"

name: mattylite
text: God damn this is spine-tingling.  There I was, all high on robot ass from a few strips ago, all laughin' it up, then this kicked me right in my human ass.  The pain is so . . . apocalyptic.

name: the_voice
text: These guys are awesome and terrifying.

name: edwell
text: In Achewood, there are more fires in Heaven than in Hell.

name: possums
text: wemt

name: keir
text:
This is one of my favourites.
"All souls was taken then. All souls did burn."
There's such a spine chilling poetic simplicity to this one.

name: mrclumpy
text: I don't even remember the narrative that brought this story to pass, and it's one of the best ones I've ever read. "wemt", "all souls did burn", rabbit with a corncob pipe and a stovepipe hat. . .

name: bathcat
text: The start of a short, lovely homage to Al Columbia.

name: fattypneumonia
text: Chubby for knowing who Al Columbia IS.

name: shutup_shutup
text: If there's one sentence in all of Achewood that I could hear and adore over and over again forever, it's "All souls did burn."

name: nice-on-water
text: I dunno, "That big bell gonna come rining'/And send all the children to Hell" has the same haunting ring.

name: hateandwar
text: I like to think that Lie Bot's plan all along was to reunite Beef and Molly, and he just needed the whole Uncle Culepepper set up as an excuse to murder Beef.

name: genequagmire
text: Steely Dan II from Yokohama?

name: puguglypress
text: That gray sky is so much scarier than a black one

name: fattypneumonia
text:
Had a girl
Now she's gone
She left town
Town burned down
Nothin' left, but the sound
Of the front door, closing
Forever.

name: mal3
text:
I remember when this strip first came online...until that point, the Super Secret Ice Cream shop was my favorite and decidedly most emotionally challenging strips.

But this...Onstad continually outdoes himself. I wish I had a quarter of his talent.

name: robocop
text: he talks like a cormac mccarthy character.

name: maidenathene
text: This is pretty much why i love this whole arc, other than its about Roast Beef.
